Articles.Content:
So a few days ago, I was playing KSP with a friend watching. He was mocking my SSTO abilities, or lack thereof. On one of my attempts at a powered landing after a suborbital flight, he laughed because I really only had a sliver of fuel and airbrakes left. As the ship came hurtling back to Kerbin, I decided to EVA the entire crew of three Kerbals around 10km from the ground. Imagine my surprise when only one died upon impact. If I recall correctly, they were doing in the neighborhood of 40-50 m/s. Anyone else experience anything like this? Is WAD in vanilla? While hilarious it seems a bit ridiculous. While I am using mods, none that should do anything to allow this.

So what exactly *is* Jeb's crash tolerance?
If they land on their helmets, it's very very high.
? Seems to vary quite a bit. 30 m/s on Kerbin for me.
If you land in water, they will almost always live. Terminal Velocity means they shouldn't die by ocean. Unless the craft was going REALLY fast.

"Only one died" ? ! ?,,, Murderer!

Seriously, someone has to yell, "Heads down!"
